intro: Dibrachya, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically feature yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plants are herbaceous and often grow in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Dibrachya species are also valued for their resilience to drought and pests.
